subtasks.result:
Ensure the child understands the following toaster safety precautions:
1. Never insert anything other than bread into the toaster.
2. Always unplug the toaster when not in use.
3. Do not touch the toaster with wet hands.
4. Keep the toaster away from water sources.
5. Never try to remove stuck items with metal objects.
6. Always supervise the toaster while it's in use.
7. In case of any issues, ask an adult for help immediately.

subtasks.title: Demonstrate safe handling of the toaster
subtasks.description: Show the child how to safely handle the toaster, including inserting and removing bread, adjusting settings, and unplugging after use.
subtasks.expected_output: Ability to handle the toaster safely without risking harm.

Title: Demonstrate safe handling of the toaster

Expected Output: Ability to handle the toaster safely without risking harm.



=== INSTRUCTION ===
You are responsible for completing the current task as part of the overall project.
Use all available context, including dependency and previous results, but present your answer as your own expert recommendation or decision.

subtasks.result:
Demonstrate to the child how to safely handle the toaster by following these steps:

1. Before using the toaster, make sure it is placed on a stable surface.
2. Plug in the toaster only when you are ready to use it.
3. When inserting bread, make sure your hands are dry to avoid any electrical hazards.
4. Adjust the settings according to the desired toast level, ensuring not to set it too high.
5. After toasting, unplug the toaster from the power outlet.
6. Use caution when removing the toast to avoid burns.
7. Wait for the toaster to cool down before storing it.

By following these steps, the child will be able to handle the toaster safely without risking harm.

subtasks.title: Instruct on proper plug handling
subtasks.description: Teach the child how to safely plug in and unplug the toaster, emphasizing the importance of keeping hands dry and avoiding contact with water.
subtasks.expected_output: Knowledge of how to handle the toaster's plug safely to prevent electrical hazards.

result.Explain toaster safety precautions:

result.Demonstrate safe handling of the toaster:

subtasks.result: To safely remove the toast from the toaster, instruct the child to use a pair of wooden or plastic tongs to grasp the toast and carefully lift it out of the toaster. Ensure the child is standing away from the toaster to avoid any risk of burns. Once the toast is removed, place it on a heat-safe surface to cool before enjoying.

subtasks.description: Instruct on how to spread butter on the toast.
subtasks.expected_output: Toast with butter spread on it.

subtasks.result: Place the buttered toast gently on a clean plate. Ensure that the toast is neatly arranged and ready to be served.

result.Remove Toast from Toaster: To safely remove the toast from the toaster, instruct the child to use a pair of wooden or plastic tongs to grasp the toast and carefully lift it out of the toaster. Ensure the child is standing away from the toaster to avoid any risk of burns. Once the toast is removed, place it on a heat-safe surface to cool before enjoying.
result.Spread Butter on Toast: Spread a generous amount of butter evenly on the toasted bread using a butter knife. Ensure that the butter covers the entire surface of the toast for a delicious and satisfying result.
result.Serve Toast on a Plate: Place the buttered toast gently on a clean plate. Ensure that the toast is neatly arranged and ready to be served.

Preparation.Check toaster accessibility: I recommend placing the toaster in a location that is easily reachable for a child and ensures safety. Make sure the toaster is accessible on a stable surface, away from the edge, and free from any obstructions that could cause accidents.
Preparation.Plug in the toaster: Plug in the toaster to a power source to ensure it is ready for use in the toast-making process.
Preparation.Gather bread, butter, knife, and plate: Bread, butter, knife, and plate are ready for use.

Safety Instructions.Explain toaster safety precautions:
Ensure the child understands the following toaster safety precautions:
1. Never insert anything other than bread into the toaster.
2. Always unplug the toaster when not in use.
3. Do not touch the toaster with wet hands.
4. Keep the toaster away from water sources.
5. Never try to remove stuck items with metal objects.
6. Always supervise the toaster while it's in use.
7. In case of any issues, ask an adult for help immediately.
Safety Instructions.Demonstrate safe handling of the toaster:
Demonstrate to the child how to safely handle the toaster by following these steps:

1. Before using the toaster, make sure it is placed on a stable surface.
2. Plug in the toaster only when you are ready to use it.
3. When inserting bread, make sure your hands are dry to avoid any electrical hazards.
4. Adjust the settings according to the desired toast level, ensuring not to set it too high.
5. After toasting, unplug the toaster from the power outlet.
6. Use caution when removing the toast to avoid burns.
7. Wait for the toaster to cool down before storing it.

By following these steps, the child will be able to handle the toaster safely without risking harm.
Safety Instructions.Instruct on proper plug handling: Demonstrate to the child how to firmly grasp the plug when inserting or removing it from the outlet. Emphasize the importance of keeping hands dry and avoiding contact with water at all times. Ensure the child understands the potential electrical hazards associated with mishandling the toaster's plug.

Toast-making Steps.Place bread in the toaster: Bread slices placed in the toaster.
Toast-making Steps.Start the toaster: Toaster started to toast the bread.

Finishing Touches.Remove Toast from Toaster: To safely remove the toast from the toaster, instruct the child to use a pair of wooden or plastic tongs to grasp the toast and carefully lift it out of the toaster. Ensure the child is standing away from the toaster to avoid any risk of burns. Once the toast is removed, place it on a heat-safe surface to cool before enjoying.
Finishing Touches.Spread Butter on Toast: Spread a generous amount of butter evenly on the toasted bread using a butter knife. Ensure that the butter covers the entire surface of the toast for a delicious and satisfying result.
Finishing Touches.Serve Toast on a Plate: Place the buttered toast gently on a clean plate. Ensure that the toast is neatly arranged and ready to be served.
